caption.center: ALLEN HEMPHILL, MOVANT/APPELLANT, v. STATE OF MISSOURI,

court.center: Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District,

date.center: Motion for Rehearing and/or Transfer to Supreme Court Denied October

opinion.posture: APPEAL FROM THE CIRCUIT COURT, OF THE CITY OF ST. LOUIS; THOMAS J. FRAWLEY, JUDGE.
opinion.attorneys:
Dave Hemingway, Public Defender, St. Louis, for appellant.
Jeremiah W. (Jay) Nixon, Attorney General, Fernando Bermudez, Assistant Attorney General, Jefferson City, for respondent.
opinion.panel: Before REINHARD, P.J., and KAROHL and WHITE, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text: [2] Movant appeals from the denial of his Rule 24.035 motion without an evidentiary hearing. We affirm. The findings and conclusions of the motion court are not clearly erroneous, and an extended opinion would have no precedential value. The parties have been furnished with a memorandum for their information only, setting forth the reasons for this order affirming the judgment pursuant to Rule 84.16(b).
